topics.body:
Well since this thread is so boring during the day I'll just post a random piece of information:
Nanoparticles potentially can get rid of *ALL* viruses.  What is being looked at medically basically what it would be is a air filter for your blood.  The way the nanoparticle works is that if you inject it into a person's blood stream only viruses would get trapped inside the structure thus making them inert.  It doesn't fight viruses so much as filters them out.  If someone has say HIV or such you could inject the person with the nanoparticles and every time a cellwall from T-cells is broken down releasing new viruses instead of infecting new cells the viruses would just get trapped like a rat in a cage instead.

topics.body:
So today my boyfriend told me that he gets random boners in English Literature class, and that's the reason why he wears thick pants. Which is weird because it's his least favorite class, but hey.

Leaving aside the fact that I have no idea what I'm supposed to do with this information, I keep laughing at the most inopportune moments today because I can just imagine the teacher - a wrinkled, gaunt, boney faced middle aged woman with an almost offensive to the eye fashion style - leaning over him with a sultry gaze whispering "Hey Marc Antony" (his role in the Shakespeare play we're currently analyzing; she takes acting out the play really seriously). It's too funny. Help.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536971396368720497160000#post_536971396368720497160000
[bq="twistedmetalero"]WOOHOO, NEW DROSS VIDEO

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8C4dENqlmKk

web driver torso, youtube mistery channel.[/bq]
You know every time I hear about how these sorts of things I can feel my brain slowly liquifying internally.

The problem with this is that if it is indeed spies transmitting classified information then the code has already been broken and the dumb thing is that since it's on youtube then it's for certain already broken and that classified information has already been leaked.  The reason being is that most of the time when codes for secret information are created the cipher to deceiver them is extremely predictable in that most of the time the way the information is transmitted is done lazily and half-assed.

A more effective way of communicating information is to have set 1, 2, 3 of dictionaries.  What I mean by that is for set 1 you have all set list of words to use in all 3 sets and for set 1 each word is randomly assigned a random number out of one million, set 2 does the same but with different random numbers for each word, set 3 does the same but with different random numbers.  Then what you do is take those three sets and prescribe randomly assigned numbers for sets of three words.  In other words a set of three words such as "the target left" could be assigned a random number anywhere from 0 to 10^24.  To crack just three words out of a sentence would take 115 days.
